data.title: Famous Athletes from Portugal
data.meta_description: List of famous athletes from Portugal, listed alphabetically with photos when available. Portugal has seen some very talented athletes over the years, many of ...
data.text:
Cristiano Ronaldo, born on February 5, 1985 in Funchal, Madeira, Portugal, is a globally recognized football player known for his extraordinary skills and precision on the field. His journey to stardom began with playing for Andorinha and Nacional during his childhood years before moving to Sporting CP soccer academy at age twelve. It was here that he honed his abilities leading to his professional debut in 2002. Ronaldo's career took a significant leap when he signed with Manchester United in 2003. His time at United saw him bagging three consecutive Premier League titles along with a UEFA Champions League title. He also won the Ballon d'Or award - an honor given annually to the world's best footballer - for the first time while being part of this team. In 2009, Ronaldo made a high-profile move to Real Madrid which further solidified his place as one of football's all-time greats. During his tenure at Madrid, he helped the club secure two La Liga titles and four Champions League trophies among other accolities. Furthermore, it was during this period that he clinched four more Ballon d'Or awards showcasing consistent excellence throughout these years. Ronaldo later signed with Juventus in 2018, citing his need for a a new challenge as his reason for leaving Real Madrid. Later he attributed his transfer to his feeling of a lack of support from the Real Madrid club president. Ronaldo signed with Al-Nassr in 2023, rsulting in an increased popularity both domestically and internationally for the Saudi Pro League.

Daniel Miguel Alves Gomes (born 7 August 1983), commonly known as Danny, is a Portuguese professional footballer who plays as an attacking midfielder. Also a winger, he is known for his dribbling and key passes.He spent most of his career in Russia in service of Dynamo Moscow and Zenit, after arriving at the age of 21 from Sporting. He won six items of silverware with Zenit, including three Russian Premier League titles. Danny represented Portugal at the 2010 World Cup and the 2004 Olympics.
